title: Mathamatical grid
content:
Is there a certain formula for greating a grid?  
my page size is 8x10.5 with 9 collumns/12 rows with a gutter  
of 0.0625 vertically and horizontally. I would like to change  
my gutter to 0.1667 in having the text justified with last line aligned left.  
It sounds like a mouthfull I know. attached is a screenshot to illustrate my  
thoughts.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130310072020im_/http:/typophile.com/files/grid_5899.jpg)
author: koop

comments.content:
I would argue that you need to do whatever makes reading the text easier for the reader(s)... Also, you are making two changes at the same time: going from ragged right to justified _and_ increasing the width of the gutter...

With justified text there is the risk of having rivers of white space (due to unequal wordspaces), but it will give you less lines of text overall.
